content.rendered:
Role

overview

We’re looking for a Junior Interior Designer to support the interior design of our expanding office spaces. You’ll be working directly with the project lead to plan, purchase, and set-up items for a new floor space. We want to create a welcome and fun space across all our offices, so the job will require travel to our other locations across Central Europe. You’ll be working with us to furnish them in a style suited to the local space, but with our iconic Vacuumlabs touches. Interior design experience is not necessary, but the position requires a hands-on approach to furnishing a large office space, contributing to design planning, and staying organized. Ideally, you are an artist, designer, or art teacher looking for a new day job and the freedom to pursue your own artistic dreams. If you think you have an eye for style, we encourage you to apply. There’s a lot of possibilities for this role to expand and lead to collaboration in the future.

Work with us

Apply now

Or send us an e-mail at

  • jobs@vacuumlabs.com

Type

Full-time job, Contractor

Monthly Compensation

1500 – 2000 €

Location 

Bratislava, Slovakia

Travel required

Who

you are

Creative

You’re an art and design enthusiast who loves to make new things.

Intuitive

You have a good feeling for how people interact with spaces and the atmosphere generated by design choices.

Detailed

You understand that small details really tie a whole design together. You can keep track of and notice small details.

Involved

You are able to work at a fast pace and adapt to growing environments. You can get engaged with our community to understand our culture, preferences, and style.

Resourceful

You know where to hunt things down and how to get things done. If something isn’t available, you find a new way to achieve your goal.

Adaptable

You can incorporate feedback and adjust your direction accordingly.

Unconventional

You understand we aren’t looking for a traditional corporate office space. You want to have meaningful contributions to a unique, friendly office space.

What you’ll do

  • Support our design team in creating a welcoming office space and share the Vacuumlabs spark across all our locations.
  • Incorporate our existing design elements and rules; collaborate on creating new ones.
  • Source and purchase items for offices - furniture, accessories, art, carpeting, lighting, plants, and finishing details.
  • Customize individual offices based on the needs and personality of the department and teams using them.
  • Communicate regularly with the project lead, architect, and back office.
  • Provide your input and ideas for designs and materials of new offices.
  • In-person and online shopping for necessary items.
  • Track purchases, interior design budget, and order statuses.
  • Maintain and Google Sheet to manage project organization, budget, and timeline.

What you need to succeed

  • Unique style, with a strong foundational interest and eye for visual art.
  • Enthusiasm and involvement in the art or design world.
  • Excellent organizational skills and follow-up on outstanding items.
  • Interpersonal and communication skills to coordinate with a variety of professionals.
  • Understanding of thematic designs, such as movie or series themed meeting rooms.
  • Can follow and adapt to existing design patterns set for our spaces.
  • Familiarity with interior design practices and methods is helpful.
  • An understanding of color, material, texture, form and how they work together.
  • Upper Intermediate English.

What

you get in return

Work with us

Apply now

Or send us an e-mail at

  • jobs@vacuumlabs.com

Compensation

1500 – 2000 € / monthly

Opportunity

Our community enables you to expand your knowledge and follow your personal projects to their fullest potential. You can speak your mind and put your ideas into motion, whether it’s your strategy to improve a process or your own spin-off company.

Autonomy

In return for the responsibility you take on, we give you the freedom to get your work done the way that suits you.

Purpose

We want your work to have a positive impact and feel meaningful. The world may not be perfect, but we always look out for product developments that can make it a better place and foster a welcoming environment.

Transparency

Salaries and their corresponding levels are open to everyone. Whenever possible, we will share the company’s decisions, triumphs, mistakes, lessons learned, and future plans.

Benefits and Perks

Work from Home and flexible hours

If you need to pick up your kids from school or head to a doctor’s appointment that’s fine with us – we let you structure your hours around your needs. Work from home is an option if you feel it suits your workflow.

Unlimited sick days

You know best how much rest you need and we trust you to use your unlimited sick days with integrity.

Vacation Days

20-25 vacation days, plus additional country-specific days off

Paid days for professional growth

We want to show our commitment to constant learning. You can arrange time for continued education, training, and tech conferences.

Performance and compensation evaluations

We offer quarterly compensation evaluations and provide feedback for your performance.

Family Friendly
We’re happy to offer paid parental leave, 2 weeks off for partners with newborns, and shortened hours for new parents who wish to return to work. 
We also host family friendly events and more.
LGBT+ Friendly

From building products like the digital bank Daylight to address underbanking in the LGBT+ community to hosting our very own pride events – we stay true to our values by taking action.

Community and team-building activities

Our events and parties help you enrich your social life and build team spirit and camaraderie with your Vacuumlabs colleagues.

Concierge services

If you get busy and the little tasks start to add up, you can ask our concierge to recommend and schedule professionals, send or receive parcels, and even have your groceries delivered to the office.

Daily lunch

Depending on the office location, we provide catering or outside meals.

Wellbeing

We provide on-site mental health professionals for both crisis intervention and long term therapy. You can also purchase a MultiSport card (currently unavailable in HU).

Apply now

Or send us an e-mail at

  • jobs@vacuumlabs.com

About

Vacuumlabs

We put the tech in fintech.

Vacuumlabs is a digital product development firm that provides design, product development, engineering, and data science services for the fintech industry. We support clients from 8 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia. The history of our successful collaborations include companies at all stages of development – leading corporations, scaleups, and startups.

Our approach to fintech is enthusiastic and inventive. We love discovering the latest technologies and seeking new opportunities for collaboration or building products of our own. We turn our values into actions by taking an active role in advocating for human rights and the improvement of society as a whole. Fintech influences matters on a global, regional, local, and personal level. Our work in this sector serves a greater purpose by increasing accessibility and financial literacy all over the world. It’s a challenging and emerging field full of opportunities. There are endless possibilities to build your own programs, products, and even create entire new business lines.

At our core, we’re proud of our people, our welcoming culture and the care we show our teams. Every great relationship is built on trust and we believe transparency is the foundation for achieving this internally, with our clients, and with the industry at large. Our responsibility for our team’s wellbeing is something we take seriously and we want them to succeed at Vacuumlabs and beyond. We demonstrate that everyday through the friendliness of our work environment, the respect we show each other, and our above-standard benefit package.

While our focus is fintech, our experience with a variety of problem solving in the industry has led to an exciting assortment of spin-offs in legal, trademark, and landmark IT conferences like ReactiveConf. Our involvement extends into creating quality content featuring the most current news and industry leaders.

Purpose and integrity underlies everything we do.
Here’s just a few of our successful projects:

Yoroi

a wallet for Ada cryptocurrency with 170 K downloads

Doconomy

carbon footprint online calculator for companies and individuals

Mox

a next-generation digital bank in Hong Kong implementing Thought Machine

Twisto

is delivering a simple and fair daily financing solution to retail customers in the CEE region.

Daylight

the first LGBT+ digital bank in the USA addressing underserved communities

Previous
Next

We are

product launchers

Our talented mix of people has even led to a variety of exciting spinoffs, including the highly successful Cardano wallet Adalite and our major tech conference ReactiveConf.

content.rendered:
Senior Product Designer

Vacuumlabs is looking for a senior product designer to join our design team.

You’ll be joining a team of designers and engineers working on some of the most exciting projects in Europe and around the world. In our offices (London, Bratislava, Prague, Kosice, Brno, Budapest, NY, Hong Kong, San Francisco) you’ll hear our teams talking about complex projects from San Francisco to Tokyo.

We are looking for people who aren’t afraid of autonomy and responsibility. People who are eager to learn new things and get better at what they do. People who want to make an impact.

Our senior designers are problem solvers who craft highly usable experiences. Together with the team they help break down business and customer problems, imagine new and beautiful solutions, and help bring great experiences to life.

Here's what you will do

  • Contribute to our most valuable design projects by making product improvements, as well as starting from scratch on new products and features
  • Explore and communicate design concepts through sketches, user flows, low fidelity wireframes or prototypes
  • Participate in design research, user research and validation testing
  • Lead 1-3 designer(s) on projects as necessary
  • Communicate with clients and stakeholders throughout the process to ensure the designs fit the business goals and technical constraints just as well as user needs
  • Work closely with engineers to bring designs to life
  • Create robust and scalable design systems
  • Advocate for best practices across the product design team and mentor less experienced designers
  • Contribute to improving end to end product delivery process, as well as our internal processes
 

A typical career path

  • Junior designer (1200-1400 EUR): You have a growth mindset and work hard to gain experience and improve your skillset. Supported by more experienced designers, you work on rather simple tasks and help with more complex ones.
  • Mid-level designer (1600-2000 EUR): As an independent contributor, you are capable of working solo on projects that are already set up. Apart from moving pixels, you can identify what hypothesis is worth to be tested and design a test to validate it.
  • Senior designer (2250-3000 EUR): Apart from contributing to our most valuable design projects, you can take a leadership role if needed. Whether it’s travelling to meet a client, helping less experienced colleagues or making a design decision, you’ll manage.

All positions include benefits. Senior positions include also equity options. 

Our application process

  • 1. Design Exercise
    The task will be to design a product on paper in 30 minutes. You can ask us questions during the process. When the countdown ends, you will present your solution.
  • 2. Design critique
    You will be searching for usability issues in the app prototype. After having 10 minutes to get familiar with the prototype, you will present us with as many usability issues as you can.
  • 3. Take-home assignment
    Your homework will be to design UI(s) specified at the end of our meeting. We’ll email to you any wireframes or assets needed for completion.
  • Choose your location: Bratislava, Košice, Prague, Brno, Budapest, Remote

Who do we look for

  • You have a deep knowledge of mobile and web app design patterns and UX best practices
  • You have an appreciation of the entire product development process, from the idea generation, research, to detailed UI and interaction design
  • You are able to simplify complex problems down to simple and elegant solutions
  • You are open to sharing your work in progress with others
  • You give honest, constructive feedback
  • You are comfortable leading Jr and Mid level designers on projects
  • You are able to make decisions and take ownership of your work
  • You are comfortable with context switching and are able to manage overseeing multiple projects
  • You have strong verbal and written English skills and are able to communicate your thoughts and ideas effectively to the team as well as international stakeholders
  • You have experience in the design user testing process (preparing testing artifacts, reviewing feedback, etc)
  • Bonus skills such as UX writing, motion design, 3D design etc. are very welcome

Type

Full-time job

MONTHLY SALARY

3,000 – 6,000 EUR

LOCATION

Bratislava, Prague, Brno, Kosice, Budapest or remote.

Apply here

Or send us an email at jobs@vacuumlabs.com

ABOVE THE SALARY

A few perks we call benefits

In Vacuumlabs we value and respect each other. We’re trying to create the best possible environment for all of us. It’s not only about material benefits, but also about helping each other grow and learn new things.

Explore the benefits

Selected clients

Life at Vacuumlabs

We value and respect each other while trying to create the best possible environment for all of us. It’s not only about material benefits, but also about helping you grow and learn new things. We call it the Vacuumlabs way.

About us

Role

overview

We’re looking for Software Engineers of all levels to join our growing community. You will be working with our frontend or backend tech stacks according to your experience. You are encouraged to apply even if you aren’t experienced with our tech stacks – we value the process and a willingness to learn. Depending on your skill level, this can be a senior position which will include leading junior developers and providing them with constructive feedback. Our demanding recruitment process is in place to ensure you can work with the most efficient and high quality team. Our engineers hold Masters and PhD degrees in computer science, win coding competitions, and have worked for leading tech giants.

Work with us

Apply now

Who

you are

Fast learner

You get oriented to new concepts quickly. You have demonstrable critical thinking skills and understand the value of reasoning out problems.

Analyst

You know how to interpret data contextually and also apply it to new situations.

Techie

You love technology but never use it for its own sake – always looking for what makes the most sense in context.

Process designer

You are process driven and detail oriented. You can design new processes, understand and modify existing ones, and retire obsolete ones.

Curious

You’re often learning new things and finding clever solutions.

Autonomous

You feel confident making decisions and suggesting your own ideas. You trust yourself and others to make the right call and take responsibility.

Open Minded

You want to be part of a welcoming community and use technology to make the world better.

Purposeful

You make well-reasoned and specific decisions. Rather than just follow trends, you would prefer to do meaningful and lasting work with technology.

What you’ll do

  • Design, develop, and improve products for the global fintech industry - including digital banks and blockchain-based products.
  • Develop and maintain an above-standard code for our products.
  • Select and apply the most appropriate framework, database, or programming language.
  • Communicate and collaborate with Product Owners and team members.

A great software engineer should have

  • Demonstrated skill in programming.
  • Past experience as a frontend, backend, or full stack developer.
  • Experience with and the ability to adapt to a variety of programming languages.
  • Strong intuition for problem solving and process improvement.
  • Ability to clearly and concisely communicate your thought process.
  • Advanced English language skills.

What

you get in return

Work with us

Apply now

Typical career path

Software engineer salary range at Vacuumlabs: 1,600 –7,300 €.
See the typical career path to learn what you can expect:

Intern X

With limited programming experience, you require close supervision. You are eager to learn and don’t give up easily.

JuniorX

You are comfortable working with standard toolchain, research information independently, and start developing a basic taste for a good code. You develop simple features under the guidance of your more experienced colleagues.

monthly salary 1,600 EUR–2,300 EUR

MidX

You can develop most of the features independently, coach less experienced colleagues, and lead small projects occasionally.

monthly salary 2,600 EUR–3,400 EUR

OR OPT FOR CONVERTING PART OF SALARY FOR COMPANY EQUITY

SeniorX

You require no supervision implementing even the hard parts of the software. You routinely lead junior colleagues and actively participate in design & code reviews. You always look at the code through the optics of its business impacts and can communicate them to the customer. You proactively research new trends and prepare talks for your colleagues and the general audience. We trust you to lead teams of 3–4 people.

monthly salary 3,700 EUR–4,500 EUR
OR OPT FOR CONVERTING PART OF SALARY FOR COMPANY EQUITY

Team LeadX

You are capable of leading the biggest of projects. You think of costs, benefits, and risks of any decision, even a bad one. You discuss, design and write documentation before writing a single line of code. If a proper software architecture doesn’t pull its weight, you advocate for a ‘quick and simple’ solution.

monthly salary 5,000 EUR–7,300 EUR (through growth within the company)

OR OPT FOR CONVERTING PART OF SALARY FOR COMPANY EQUITY

Salary

1600 – 7300 € and Equity

Opportunity

Our community enables you to expand your knowledge and follow your personal projects to their fullest potential. You can speak your mind and put your ideas into motion, whether it’s your strategy to improve a process or your own spin-off company.

Autonomy

In return for the responsibility you take on, we give you the freedom to get your work done the way that suits you.

Purpose

We want your work to have a positive impact and feel meaningful. The world may not be perfect, but we always look out for product developments that can make it a better place and foster a welcoming environment.

Transparency

Compensation amounts and their corresponding levels are open to everyone. Whenever possible, we will share the company’s decisions, triumphs, mistakes, lessons learned, and future plans.

Benefits and Perks

Work from Home and flexible hours

If you need to pick up your kids from school or head to a doctor’s appointment that’s fine with us – we let you structure your hours around your needs. Work from home is an option if you feel it suits your workflow.

Unlimited sick days

You know best how much rest you need and we trust you to use your unlimited sick days with integrity.

Vacation Days

20-25 vacation days, plus additional country-specific days off

Paid days for professional growth

We want to show our commitment to constant learning. You can arrange time for continued education, training, and tech conferences.

Performance and compensation evaluations

We offer quarterly compensation evaluations and provide feedback for your performance.

Family Friendly
We’re happy to offer paid parental leave, 2 weeks off for partners with newborns, and shortened hours for new parents who wish to return to work. 
We also host family friendly events and more.
LGBT+ Friendly

From building products like the digital bank Daylight to address underbanking in the LGBT+ community to hosting our very own pride events – we stay true to our values by taking action.

Community and team-building activities

Our events and parties help you enrich your social life and build team spirit and camaraderie with your Vacuumlabs colleagues.

Concierge services

If you get busy and the little tasks start to add up, you can ask our concierge to recommend and schedule professionals, send or receive parcels, and even have your groceries delivered to the office.

Daily lunch

Depending on the office location, we provide catering or outside meals.

Wellbeing

We provide on-site mental health professionals for both crisis intervention and long term therapy. You can also purchase a MultiSport card (currently unavailable in HU).

If you made it till the end, you’ve shown the dedication and patience that truly makes a great software engineer. Are you curious if Vacuumlabs is the right fit for you? Give it a try and apply now.

Apply now

Ready to take on the challenge?

Please enter your name and email, and we'll send you a link with further instructions on how to begin. Remember that this challenge has a time limit and that it doesn't matter what tech stack you use. Good luck!

Role

overview

If you’re enthusiastic about data and want to work in a rapidly developing sector, join us as a Data Scientist. You’ll be utilizing data analytical tools to craft solutions and contribute to product development. You’ll be using the latest approaches in data acquisition, preparation, and feature engineering to apply and deploy machine learning models. This role will be working closely with developers, project managers, and product designers. Depending on your level, there are opportunities for acting as a mentor to junior colleagues and speaking at events.

Work with us

Apply now

Or send us an e-mail at

  • jobs@vacuumlabs.com

Type

Full-time job, Contractor

Monthly Compensation

1,600 – 5,000 €

Location

Bratislava, Prague

Who

you are

Analyst

You can interpret data in context and also apply it to relevant situations.

Involved

You keep an eye on new developments in data science and feel curious about the fintech industry.

Communicative

You can express complex ideas and results in a clear and concise manner. You stay in touch with your colleagues and keep the team updated.

Critical Thinker

You reason through problems carefully and have well thought out arguments for your plans.

Autonomous

You can work independently and without much guidance. You can accept responsibility and trust yourself to make important decisions.

Proactive

You can seek out and plan new projects in the realms of data of your own volition. You’re very hands-on in your approach and can make suggestions for process improvements.

What you’ll do

  • Discover and utilize approaches that cover the entire data science pipeline.
  • Through exploratory data analysis, suggest process improvements and next steps.
  • Work with software engineers and project managers to actualize your insights.
  • Visualize and present your data analysis in a clear manner.
  • Help guide and develop ways to implement the results of your data analysis.
  • If at a senior level, guide junior colleagues and provide constructive feedback.
  • Peer review colleagues findings and reports to maintain quality and cross reference within the team.

What you need to succeed

  • Demonstrated analytical skills and ability to reason.
  • A deep understanding of how to interpret data and it’s real world applications.
  • Previous work or other documented experience in data preparation, modeling, exploratory analysis, and deployed supervised or unsupervised machine learning algorithms.
  • Knowledge of SQL and experience with SQL data modeling.
  • Knowledge of Python and SciPy ecosystem including Pandas, Numpy, or Scikit-learn.
  • Basic knowledge of Linux.
  • Experience with data visualization.
  • Familiarity with version control systems (git).

What

you get in return

Work with us

Apply now

Or send us an e-mail at

  • jobs@vacuumlabs.com

Compensation

1,600 – 5,000 € / monthly

Opportunity

Our community enables you to expand your knowledge and follow your personal projects to their fullest potential. You can speak your mind and put your ideas into motion, whether it’s your strategy to improve a process or your own spin-off company.

Autonomy

In return for the responsibility you take on, we give you the freedom to get your work done the way that suits you.

Purpose

We want your work to have a positive impact and feel meaningful. The world may not be perfect, but we always look out for product developments that can make it a better place and foster a welcoming environment.

Transparency

Salaries and their corresponding levels are open to everyone. Whenever possible, we will share the company’s decisions, triumphs, mistakes, lessons learned, and future plans.

Benefits and Perks

Work from Home and flexible hours

If you need to pick up your kids from school or head to a doctor’s appointment that’s fine with us – we let you structure your hours around your needs. Work from home is an option if you feel it suits your workflow.

Unlimited sick days

You know best how much rest you need and we trust you to use your unlimited sick days with integrity.

Vacation Days

20-25 vacation days, plus additional country-specific days off

Paid days for professional growth

We want to show our commitment to constant learning. You can arrange time for continued education, training, and tech conferences.

Performance and compensation evaluations

We offer quarterly compensation evaluations and provide feedback for your performance.

Family Friendly
We’re happy to offer paid parental leave, 2 weeks off for partners with newborns, and shortened hours for new parents who wish to return to work. 
We also host family friendly events and more.
LGBT+ Friendly

From building products like the digital bank Daylight to address underbanking in the LGBT+ community to hosting our very own pride events – we stay true to our values by taking action.

Community and team-building activities

Our events and parties help you enrich your social life and build team spirit and camaraderie with your Vacuumlabs colleagues.

Concierge services

If you get busy and the little tasks start to add up, you can ask our concierge to recommend and schedule professionals, send or receive parcels, and even have your groceries delivered to the office.

Daily lunch

Depending on the office location, we provide catering or outside meals.

Wellbeing

We provide on-site mental health professionals for both crisis intervention and long term therapy. You can also purchase a MultiSport card (currently unavailable in HU).

Apply now

Or send us an e-mail at

  • jobs@vacuumlabs.com

About

Vacuumlabs

We put the tech in fintech.

Vacuumlabs is a digital product development firm that provides design, product development, engineering, and data science services for the fintech industry. We support clients from 8 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia. The history of our successful collaborations include companies at all stages of development – leading corporations, scaleups, and startups.

Our approach to fintech is enthusiastic and inventive. We love discovering the latest technologies and seeking new opportunities for collaboration or building products of our own. We turn our values into actions by taking an active role in advocating for human rights and the improvement of society as a whole. Fintech influences matters on a global, regional, local, and personal level. Our work in this sector serves a greater purpose by increasing accessibility and financial literacy all over the world. It’s a challenging and emerging field full of opportunities. There are endless possibilities to build your own programs, products, and even create entire new business lines.

At our core, we’re proud of our people, our welcoming culture and the care we show our teams. Every great relationship is built on trust and we believe transparency is the foundation for achieving this internally, with our clients, and with the industry at large. Our responsibility for our team’s wellbeing is something we take seriously and we want them to succeed at Vacuumlabs and beyond. We demonstrate that everyday through the friendliness of our work environment, the respect we show each other, and our above-standard benefit package.

While our focus is fintech, our experience with a variety of problem solving in the industry has led to an exciting assortment of spin-offs in legal, trademark, and landmark IT conferences like ReactiveConf. Our involvement extends into creating quality content featuring the most current news and industry leaders.

Purpose and integrity underlies everything we do.
Here’s just a few of our successful projects:

Yoroi

a wallet for Ada cryptocurrency with 170 K downloads

Doconomy

carbon footprint online calculator for companies and individuals

Mox

a next-generation digital bank in Hong Kong implementing Thought Machine

Twisto

is delivering a simple and fair daily financing solution to retail customers in the CEE region.

Daylight

the first LGBT+ digital bank in the USA addressing underserved communities

Previous
Next

We are

product launchers

Our talented mix of people has even led to a variety of exciting spinoffs, including the highly successful Cardano wallet Adalite and our major tech conference ReactiveConf.

overview

Role

overview

We’re looking for a frontend UI developer to join our development teams in building fintech products for clients around the world. Your essential function will be translating documentation from the design team into code that can render UI. Depending on your level, you’ll be providing various degrees of input on the proposed structure of the code and design elements. You’ll need to maintain a clean code that others can update with ease. Our demanding recruitment process is in place to ensure you can work with the most efficient and high quality team. Our engineers hold Masters and PhD degrees in computer science, win coding competitions, and have worked for leading tech giants.

Work with us

Apply now

Or send us an e-mail at

  • jobs@vacuumlabs.com

Type

Full-time job, Contractor

Monthly Compensation

1600 – 5000 € + Equity

Location

Bratislava, Prague, Brno, Kosice, Budapest, Remote

Who

you are

Fast Learner

You are curious about new concepts and catch on quickly. We are working on a variety of products so continuous education is part of the role.

Techie

You’re interested in new developments in technology, always selecting what makes the most sense in context – you aren’t driven by trends and fads.

Analytical

You can understand, analyze, and apply data in context and incorporate it into future decisions.

Creative

You have a spark of creativity and are able to apply your technical background to design and end-user needs.

Open Minded

You want to be part of an opening and inventive community. You can approach problems and challenges from different angles.

Autonomous

You feel comfortable making decisions and suggesting your own ideas. You trust yourself and others to make the right call and take responsibility.

What you’ll do

  • Turn Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, and Photoshop designs into functioning code for UI.
  • Collaborate with your team on structure a clear, well designed code/
  • Provide input on design updates and elements, including UI/UX design that builds on the existing design.
  • Work with web and mobile based technologies depending on the project.
  • Communicate within your team and with the design department to collaborate on design and maintain project sync.

What you need to succeed

  • Solid knowledge of HTML and CSS.
  • Familiarity with SASS, Less, BEM, Atomic Design, TailwindCSS.
  • Ability to navigate the interface of design programs like AdobeXD and Figma.
  • Programming experience. We are using React.js - a willingness to learn is welcome if you have foundational knowledge or experience.
  • Intuitive feel for good UX/UI design - you consider high quality design and usability from the inception of the product to the final stages.
  • Advanced English language skills.
  • Ability to clearly and concisely communicate your plans and thought process.

What

you get in return

Work with us

  • jobs@vacuumlabs.com

1600 – 5000 € / monthly + Equity

Opportunity

Our community enables you to expand your knowledge and follow your personal projects to their fullest potential. You can speak your mind and put your ideas into motion, whether it’s your strategy to improve a process or your own spin-off company.

Autonomy

Work from Home and flexible hours

If you need to pick up your kids from school or head to a doctor’s appointment that’s fine with us – we let you structure your hours around your needs. Work from home is an option if you feel it suits your workflow.

Unlimited sick days

You know best how much rest you need and we trust you to use your unlimited sick days with integrity.

20-25 vacation days, plus additional country-specific days off

Performance and salary evaluations
We offer quarterly salary evaluations and provide feedback for your performance.
Family Friendly
We’re happy to offer paid parental leave, 2 weeks off for partners with newborns, and shortened hours for new parents who wish to return to work. 
We also host family friendly events and more.
LGBT+ Friendly

From building products like the digital bank Daylight to address underbanking in the LGBT+ community to hosting our very own pride events – we stay true to our values by taking action.

Community and team-building activities

Our events and parties help you enrich your social life and build team spirit and camaraderie with your Vacuumlabs colleagues.

Concierge services

If you get busy and the little tasks start to add up, you can ask our concierge to recommend and schedule professionals, send or receive parcels, and even have your groceries delivered to the office.

Daily lunch

Depending on the office location, we provide catering or outside meals.

Wellbeing

Apply now

Or send us an e-mail at

  • jobs@vacuumlabs.com

About

Vacuumlabs

We put the tech in fintech.

Vacuumlabs is a digital product development firm that provides design, product development, engineering, and data science services for the fintech industry. We support clients from 8 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia. The history of our successful collaborations include companies at all stages of development – leading corporations, scaleups, and startups.

Our approach to fintech is enthusiastic and inventive. We love discovering the latest technologies and seeking new opportunities for collaboration or building products of our own. We turn our values into actions by taking an active role in advocating for human rights and the improvement of society as a whole. Fintech influences matters on a global, regional, local, and personal level. Our work in this sector serves a greater purpose by increasing accessibility and financial literacy all over the world. It’s a challenging and emerging field full of opportunities. There are endless possibilities to build your own programs, products, and even create entire new business lines.

At our core, we’re proud of our people, our welcoming culture and the care we show our teams. Every great relationship is built on trust and we believe transparency is the foundation for achieving this internally, with our clients, and with the industry at large. Our responsibility for our team’s wellbeing is something we take seriously and we want them to succeed at Vacuumlabs and beyond. We demonstrate that everyday through the friendliness of our work environment, the respect we show each other, and our above-standard benefit package.

While our focus is fintech, our experience with a variety of problem solving in the industry has led to an exciting assortment of spin-offs in legal, trademark, and landmark IT conferences like ReactiveConf. Our involvement extends into creating quality content featuring the most current news and industry leaders.

Purpose and integrity underlies everything we do.

Role

overview

As our Sales Marketing Director, you will be responsible for planning and executing creative, data-driven campaigns that deliver highly qualified leads for the sales team. You will create and own a portfolio of outbound and account-based campaigns, executing end-to-end across a mixture of channels including content syndication, email, media sponsorship, webinars, and events.

This role is an exciting opportunity to lead sales marketing, identify new potential in the fintech industry, and implement innovative strategies that help us acquire and retain clients.

Work with us

Apply now

Or send us an e-mail at

  • jobs@vacuumlabs.com

Full-time job, Contractor

Location

Who

you are

Involved

You’re active in the fintech industry and want to be an important part of its future. You’re excited about innovation in fintech and stay updated on industry developments.

Adept

You have substantial experience in sales marketing and fintech, with an expert understanding of inbound and outbound marketing tactics and digital marketing channels.

Resolute

You aren’t easily turned away or dissuaded by obstacles, always finding a creative way to face even the biggest challenge.

Curious

You feel enthusiastic about investigating new markets and running international campaigns.

Adaptable

You can accommodate changing priorities and meet the demands of a fast growing company in a rapidly developing industry.

Connected

You love to meet with a variety of professionals and can share your ideas confidently.

Persuasive

You can build a case for necessary resources, presenting your arguments to leadership and relevant departments. You’re confident in your presentation and pick your battles well.

Autonomous

You feel comfortable taking initiative on important projects and pursuing new ideas on your own accord. You trust yourself to set the right goals and meet a challenge.

What you’ll do

  • Oversee all of the tactics used to develop and cultivate long-term client relationships.
  • Employ strategies to help Vacuumlabs enter and succeed in the new markets, advertise and sell our propositions to target customers, and articulate our competitive edge.
  • Develop and execute short and long-term multi-channel campaigns to drive leads and the sales pipeline.
  • Design and execute complex, end-to-end marketing campaigns that deliver measurable results.
  • Launch both local and international campaigns that meet specific and data-driven goals.
  • Act as a strategic sparring partner to our Chief Sales Officer.
  • Establish marketing infrastructure that enables targeting and segmentation strategies.
  • Develop customer personas and create new campaign strategies tailored for them.
  • Provide support and input on case studies and relevant content creation for sales.
  • Deliver marketing programs that capture and nurture leads across multiple channels.
  • Collaborate with the Data & Performance Marketing Team to optimize campaigns.
  • Communicate sales targets and campaign intent to the Content Marketing Team.
  • Establish an in-depth understanding of the Vacuumlabs vision and our target clients.
  • Identify client priorities and their needs at all stages of their buyer journey.
  • Integrate lessons from past campaigns to create improved strategies for lead generation.
  • Developing performance reports to leadership and departments you partner with.
  • Act as a touchpoint between the marketing team and executives.

What you need to succeed

  • A background in fintech or professional services to best assess and advise on sales marketing strategies and selecting appropriate messaging channels.
  • Extensive background demonstrating expert understanding of inbound and outbound marketing tactics.
  • Robust understanding of digital marketing channels - particularly SEO and SEM, PPC, social media, and email.
  • Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
  • A background in planning and executing international marketing campaigns that had a measurable impact on growth.
  • Proven experience in sales lead generation in the B2B technology sector, specifically in fintech is an advantage.
  • Past experience working in a fast-paced and quickly growing business is a plus.
  • Proven experience with managing ongoing marketing relationships with clients, including continued collaboration on marketing content and guest appearances.
  • Hands-on experience working with marketing technologies - Pipedrive, Google Analytics+ , Google Ads.
  • Fluent/Native in English. Proficiency in Slovak/Czech is a plus.

What

you get in return

Work with us

4000 – 7500 € / monthly and Equity

Apply now

Vacuumlabs

We put the tech in fintech.

We launch products and provide solution architecture for fintech, cryptocurrency, and digital banking. Our work can be found from Singapore to San Francisco. Since 2012, our community has grown to 300+ professionals across 6 offices in Europe.

Our calling is to work on challenging projects that have a positive impact on the world and promote conscious consumer behavior. We cultivate a welcoming company culture where everyone gets a voice. overview

We’re looking for Android developers to join our talented teams in Bratislava, Košice, Prague, Brno, Budapest, or anywhere in the world remotely. If you’re enthusiastic about clean code and have a background in Android development we welcome you to apply and learn more about our growing community. We’re currently hiring various skill levels and value a strong foundation of analytical thinking and determination to learn. In a senior position, this job will also entail leading a team of junior developers and providing feedback where necessary. Our demanding recruitment process is in place to ensure you can work with the most efficient and high quality team. Our engineers hold Masters and PhD degrees in computer science, win coding competitions, and have worked for leading tech giants.

Techie

You love technology but never use it for its own sake – always looking for what makes the most sense in context.

Process designer

You are process driven and detail oriented. You can design new processes, understand and modify existing ones, and retire obsolete ones.

Curious

You’re often learning new things and finding clever solutions.

Autonomous

You feel confident making decisions and suggesting your own ideas. You trust yourself and others to make the right call and take responsibility.

  • Manage the fragment and activity lifecycle.
  • Support ongoing projects by implementing new features.
  • Plan out and provide support for UX design.
  • Share your knowledge and experience with your team.
  • Test features and fix application bugs.

A great Android developer should have

  • Strong understanding and experience with Kotlin.
  • Experience with Android Jetpack libraries: Navigation, DataBinding, WorkManager, LifeData, Room.
  • Knowledge of frameworks such as Retrofit, Moshi, Glide, Lottie.
  • Experience with unit testing.
  • Understanding of intuitive UX design.
  • Background in supporting the whole lifecycle of Android apps: initial setup, development, building process, and distribution to end users.

You feel confident making decisions and suggesting your own ideas. You trust yourself and others to make the right call and take responsibility.

Open Minded

You want to be part of a welcoming community and use technology to make the world better.

Purposeful

You make well-reasoned and specific decisions. Rather than just follow trends, you would prefer to do meaningful and lasting work with technology.

What you’ll do

  • Writing and maintaining code for a variety of projects in fintech - including blockchain startups, scaleups, and large corporations.
  • Write apps with UIKit and SwiftUI.
  • Support ongoing projects by implementing new features.
  • Navigate the App Store Connect and pitfalls of Apple certificates for distribution and push notifications.
  • Plan out and provide support for UX design.
  • Understanding of intuitive UX design.
  • Share your knowledge and experience in iOS with your team.
  • Fix application bugs, maintain code, and implement updates.

A great iOS developer should have

  • Familiarity with different libraries and frameworks such as Alamofire, CoreData, Realm, Combine, RxSwift, etc and their application.
  • Ability to understand and select the best framework for each individual project.
  • Background in supporting the whole lifecycle of iOS apps: initial setup, development, building process, and successful distribution in the App Store for end users.
  • Strong intuition for problem solving and process improvement.
  • Ability to clearly and concisely communicate your thought process.
  • Advanced English language skills

What

you get in return

Work with us

Apply now

Compensation

1600 – 7300 € / monthly and Equity

Opportunity

Our community enables you to expand your knowledge and follow your personal projects to their fullest potential. You can speak your mind and put your ideas into motion, whether it’s your strategy to improve a process or your own spin-off company.

Autonomy

In return for the responsibility you take on, we give you the freedom to get your work done the way that suits you.

Purpose

We want your work to have a positive impact and feel meaningful. The world may not be perfect, but we always look out for product developments that can make it a better place and foster a welcoming environment.

Transparency

Fees and their corresponding levels are open to everyone. Whenever possible, we will share the company’s decisions, triumphs, mistakes, lessons learned, and future plans.

Benefits and Perks

Work from Home and flexible hours
If you need to pick up your kids from school or head to a doctor’s appointment that’s fine with us – we let you structure your hours around your needs. Work from home is an option if you feel it suits your workflow.
Unlimited sick days
You know best how much rest you need and we trust you to use your unlimited sick days with integrity.
Vacation Days
20-25 vacation days, plus additional country-specific days off.
Paid days for professional growth

We want to show our commitment to constant learning. You can arrange time for continued education, training, and tech conferences.

Performance and salary evaluations
We offer quarterly salary evaluations and provide feedback for your performance.
Family Friendly
We’re happy to offer paid parental leave, 2 weeks off for partners with newborns, and shortened hours for new parents who wish to return to work. We also host family friendly events and more.
LGBT+ Friendly
From building products like the digital bank Daylight addressing underbanking in the LGBT+ community to hosting our very own pride events – we stay true to our values by taking action.
Community and team-building activities

Our events and parties help you enrich your social life and build team spirit and camaraderie with your Vacuumlabs colleagues.

Concierge services
If you get busy and the little tasks start to add up, you can ask our concierge to recommend and schedule professionals, send or receive parcels, and even have your groceries delivered to the office.
Daily lunch
Depending on the office location, we provide catering or outside meals.
Mental Wellbeing
We provide on-site mental health professionals for both crisis intervention and long term therapy. You can also purchase a MultiSport card (currently unavailable in HU)
Apply now

Ready to take on the challenge?

Please enter your name and email, and we'll send you a link with further instructions on how to begin. Remember that this challenge has a time limit and that it doesn't matter what tech stack you use. Good luck!

About

Vacuumlabs

We put the tech in fintech.

We launch products and provide solution architecture for fintech, cryptocurrency, and digital banking. Our work can be found from Singapore to San Francisco. Since 2012, our community has grown to 300+ professionals across 6 offices in Europe.

Our calling is to work on challenging projects that have a positive impact on the world and promote conscious consumer behavior. We cultivate a welcoming company culture where everyone gets a voice. Trust is the foundation of all relationships and our transparency is how we build trust internally, with our clients, and within the industry as a whole. Most importantly, your well-being is our priority and we demonstrate that everyday through the friendliness of our work environment, the respect we show each other, and our above-standard benefit package.

We also stelect our technology based on common sense application, not just trends. We love exploring modern frameworks and languages including React, React Native, Clojure, Kotlin, and Haskell.

Purpose and integrity underlies everything we do.

a wallet for Ada cryptocurrency with 170 K downloads

is delivering a simple and fair daily financing solution to retail customers in the CEE region.

product launchers

Role

overview

As our Sales Marketing Director, you will be responsible for planning and executing creative, data-driven campaigns that deliver highly qualified leads for the sales team. You will create and own a portfolio of outbound and account-based campaigns, executing end-to-end across a mixture of channels including content syndication, email, media sponsorship, webinars, and events.

This role is an exciting opportunity to lead sales marketing, identify new potential in the fintech industry, and implement innovative strategies that help us acquire and retain clients.

Work with us

Apply now

  • jobs@vacuumlabs.com

Type

Full-time job, Contractor

4000 – 7500 € and Equity

Location

Who

you are

Involved

You’re active in the fintech industry and want to be an important part of its future. You’re excited about innovation in fintech and stay updated on industry developments.

Adept

You have substantial experience in sales marketing and fintech, with an expert understanding of inbound and outbound marketing tactics and digital marketing channels.

Resolute

You aren’t easily turned away or dissuaded by obstacles, always finding a creative way to face even the biggest challenge.

Curious

You feel enthusiastic about investigating new markets and running international campaigns.

Adaptable

You can accommodate changing priorities and meet the demands of a fast growing company in a rapidly developing industry.

Connected

You love to meet with a variety of professionals and can share your ideas confidently.

Persuasive

You can build a case for necessary resources, presenting your arguments to leadership and relevant departments. You’re confident in your presentation and pick your battles well.

Autonomous

You feel comfortable taking initiative on important projects and pursuing new ideas on your own accord. You trust yourself to set the right goals and meet a challenge.

What you’ll do

  • Oversee all of the tactics used to develop and cultivate long-term client relationships.
  • Employ strategies to help Vacuumlabs enter and succeed in the new markets, advertise and sell our propositions to target customers, and articulate our competitive edge.
  • Develop and execute short and long-term multi-channel campaigns to drive leads and the sales pipeline.
  • Design and execute complex, end-to-end marketing campaigns that deliver measurable results.
  • Launch both local and international campaigns that meet specific and data-driven goals.
  • Act as a strategic sparring partner to our Chief Sales Officer.
  • Establish marketing infrastructure that enables targeting and segmentation strategies.
  • Develop customer personas and create new campaign strategies tailored for them.
  • Provide support and input on case studies and relevant content creation for sales.
  • Deliver marketing programs that capture and nurture leads across multiple channels.
  • Collaborate with the Data & Performance Marketing Team to optimize campaigns.
  • Communicate sales targets and campaign intent to the Content Marketing Team.
  • Establish an in-depth understanding of the Vacuumlabs vision and our target clients.
  • Identify client priorities and their needs at all stages of their buyer journey.
  • Integrate lessons from past campaigns to create improved strategies for lead generation.
  • Developing performance reports to leadership and departments you partner with.
  • Act as a touchpoint between the marketing team and executives.

What you need to succeed

  • A background in fintech or professional services to best assess and advise on sales marketing strategies and selecting appropriate messaging channels.
  • Extensive background demonstrating expert understanding of inbound and outbound marketing tactics.
  • Robust understanding of digital marketing channels - particularly SEO and SEM, PPC, social media, and email.
  • Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
  • A background in planning and executing international marketing campaigns that had a measurable impact on growth.
  • Proven experience in sales lead generation in the B2B technology sector, specifically in fintech is an advantage.
  • Past experience working in a fast-paced and quickly growing business is a plus.
  • Proven experience with managing ongoing marketing relationships with clients, including continued collaboration on marketing content and guest appearances.
  • Hands-on experience working with marketing technologies - Pipedrive, Google Analytics+ , Google Ads.
  • Fluent/Native in English. Proficiency in Slovak/Czech is a plus.

Office Manager for Budapest Office

We are looking for an Office Manager who will be responsible for running our Budapest office in Hungary.

About Vacuumlabs

Vacuumlabs is a team of 300+ engineers and designers. Our track record shows dozens of state of the art solutions delivered to startups and companies of all sizes.

Here’s what you will do

  • Office area:
    • Taking care of the whole office (check the cleanliness, solving of any problems)
    • Ordering lunch, stationery, coffee, office supplies, snacks
    • Ordering electronics, administrating orders 
    • Booking business trips
    • Managing ad-hoc COVID testing for our employees
    • Close cooperation with Community manager and financial manager in the office and other Office managers
    • Handling mail
  • Financial area:
    • Cash register management – reimbursement of expenses, prepayments
    • Invoices approving, budgets controlling, receipts collecting
    • Preparing reports for Head of the office, Finance and HR
  • HR and benefits area:
    • Organizing company events and team buildings (regular and ad-hoc)
    • Supporting people during onboarding process (contract preparation, introduction to the office, help during first days)
    • Supporting people during offboarding process
    • Helping team members with their personal needs (example: researching the best service provider for a renovation project / hairdresser / daycare / etc.)
    • Preparing bi-weekly breakfasts and daily snacks for office visitors

What experience/skills you need

  • English – fluent
  • Ability to work with MS Excel or Google sheet when preparing reports
  • Professional, polite and friendly approach
  • Experience in a similar field is an advantage
  • Flexible approach to work – you don’t mind prepare the breakfast or help colleagues with unexpected tasks

 

What do we offer

  • All-day catering
  • Taxi for company purposes or late night company events
  • Regular team building activities – company offsites, online lunches,…
  • Paid sick days
  • Ad-hoc COVID testing for free

content.rendered:
Managing Director, Americas

Vacuumlabs is looking for a Managing Director to lead our growth in the Americas.

About Vacuumlabs

Vacuumlabs is a team of 200+ engineers and designers. Our track record shows dozens of state of the art solutions delivered to startups and companies of all sizes.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and promote diversity across all of our touchpoints.

About the opportunity

The Managing Director, Americas will be responsible for the strategy, execution, and management of Vacuumlabs’ growth across the Americas. The MD will be expected to maintain and grow relationships with some of the most exciting fintechs in North and South America. 

There is an extensive entrepreneurial opportunity with this role, as not only will you be trusted to build a book of business in the region, but you will be tasked with planning regional expansion in collaboration with global management. This could include the establishment of delivery center(s) in LatAm and the identification of partners and acquisition targets across the region.

Sales responsibilities will include identifying prospects, finding leads, negotiating contracts, closing deals, and managing accounts. The successful candidate will have the ability to work with clients as partners and create opportunities across the ecosystem.

Applicants should have knowledge of the financial services industry and be interested in the latest in fintech, insurtech, and venture capital investments in the financial services and wider tech industry. Familiarity with the principles, tools, and technologies of modern software design and development is also required.

Vacuumlabs leadership expects that the Managing Director, Americas will embrace Vacuumlabs’ culture of excellence, high ethical standards, and commitment to diversity. 

Here’s what you will do

  • Build a growth plan to meet sales targets and support regional projects.
  • Prospect for new business and identifying target opportunities.
  • Collaborat with the Marketing team to develop and support a regional marketing plan.
  • Negotiate and close deals with new and existing customers.
  • Establish, build, and maintain client relationships at all decision levels.
  • Collaborate with the global management team on the planning and potential implementation of regional delivery center(s) for strategy, design, and/or engineering as relevant.
  • Represent Vacuumlabs at relevant events and with various publications and media.
  • Travel to meet with clients or potential clients around the Americas region.

You might be a great fit if you

  • Enjoy looking for and winning new business opportunities.
  • Enjoy networking and growing relationships with banks, corporates, startups, and investors.
  • Thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and are motivated to make your own path and create growth opportunities.
  • Are a team player and work well with colleagues and customers.
  • Are excited to learn about emerging technology and the latest in the venture capital/investment space.

You can ideally showcase the following

  • Demonstrated success in growing and managing a business or business line, ideally in sale of services and/or consulting.
  • A minimum of 10 years of experience, with at least 3 years in management, ideally in a high growth environment.
  • Strong experience selling to Series A or later stage tech businesses. 
  • Strong contacts within the fintech ecosystem in the US & Canada; Latin America contacts are a bonus.
  • A curiosity about business trends and customer pain points.
  • Experienced across the entire sales life cycle and a desire to build credibility at every part of an engagement.
  • Knowledge of regional languages (Spanish, Portuguese, French) is a plus but certainly not a requirement
  • Deep knowledge of the financial services industry and ecosystem.
  • Experience growing and leading sales organizations in technology and/or financial services.
  • A passion for high-growth tech firms and a soft spot for founders facing the challenge of reaching scale.

We are most interested in entrepreneurial candidates that will grow with us—that is far more important than ticking all the experience boxes.

Type

Full-time job

MONTHLY SALARY

Commensurate with experience + commissions

LOCATION

United States/Canada, remote

Apply here

Or send us an email at jobs@vacuumlabs.com

ABOVE THE SALARY

A few perks we call benefits

In Vacuumlabs we value and respect each other. We’re trying to create the best possible environment for all of us. It’s not only about material benefits, but also about helping each other grow and learn new things.

content.rendered:
Service Design Director

Vacuumlabs is hiring a Service Design Director to lead our new Service Design team.

About Vacuumlabs

Vacuumlabs is a team of 200+ engineers and designers. Our track record shows dozens of state of the art solutions delivered to startups and companies of all sizes.

The Opportunity

You’ll be a service design director across a range of fintech and software projects, where you’ll be a key driver in defining and designing products—either those that we develop ourselves or our clients’. You’ll also help grow the service design function across the organization, nurturing talent and working with sales teams to help close product deals. 

Our directors are problem solvers and leaders in one. They break down business and customer problems, imagine new and beautiful solutions, and help bring great experiences to life. They are versatile jack of all trades with strong opinions, weakly held in the face of constant change. They find the balance between business and customer needs to steer a path to the best product.

You will:

  • Act  as a guide for the team and the client through exploring What has to be built and How it should be conceptualized
  • Participate in the whole process from the initial pitch through product delivery     
  • Decide on the best research: helping the clients and us to understand the problem and real user needs; and pragmatically choosing the most suitable methods;
  • Work with clients and internal teams to evolve the product strategy and translate it into a product vision. You set the big picture, and support the teams in turning the vision into the product.
  • You will also act as the gatekeeper of insight, no matter how small, that matters for an excellent user experience 
  • Ensure that research and insights are inspiring and translatable by the teams into innovative products and improved features 
  • Be responsible for managing a team and supporting and advising other teams – design, product, and engineering
  • Be responsible for leading training and development in user research, design thinking, lean UX and other creative processes

You should:

  • Have worked in digital product creation for 10+ years, half of which has been in a position that entails service design, innovation process, and research
  • Have managed a team of researchers, UX and UI designers and other creatives
  • Have helped shipped multiple products to market and can point to examples
  • Have spent a period of time working in a client services business
  • Have not only knowledge about service design and research methodology but also the wisdom / common sense to use it well
  • Have a deep love for human psychology, behavioral sciences and design

Type

Full-time job

MONTHLY SALARY

5,000 – 7,500 EUR

LOCATION

Prague, Lisbon, Bratislava, remote CET±1

Quality Assurance Engineer

As a QA Engineer at Vacuumlabs, you will be working alongside 300+ talented individuals on projects that make an impact!

Join us in one of our modern offices in Kosice, Bratislava, Prague, Brno, Budapest or choose to work remotely, as that is an option too.

About Vacuumlabs

We are Vacuumlabs, a design and software development partner. We work hard to bring the technology of the 21st century to the banking industry. Cryptocurrencies are the future, that’s why we’ve created the safest crypto wallet for the world’s 7th largest cryptocurrency — Cardano.

We are searching particularly for people, who aren’t afraid of autonomy and responsibility; colleagues who are eager to learn new things and improve at what they do.

You will have an impact. We aren’t afraid of supporting your side projects. A good example is ReactiveConf: our side project has grown into one of the top 5 tech conferences in the world in its field.

In this role you will work on:

  • Setting up processes to integrate automated testing in the development pipeline.
  • Designing, writing and managing tests.
  • Redesigning and rewriting tests for our clients.
  • A bit of DevOps such as dealing with CI, testing environments and reporting.

You are the right fit for this position if:

  • You are a person who is thorough in their research and thinks of every possibility.
  • You are brave enough to step up and stop a release if you are not confident in the product.
  • You are self-sufficient and you actively look for areas of improvement.
  • You are the kind of person that orders -1.5 beers to see what happens

Full-time job

content.rendered:
Trademark guru

We are looking for someone with strong trademark know-how and management experience to ensure quality delivery and development of the legal operations team.

About Trama

The brand is one of the most valuable assets of any business. Unfortunately, many entrepreneurs struggle to protect it. We’re lawyers and tech entrepreneurs who joined forces to bring 21st-century technology to the world of Law. Our aim is to reshape brand protection and provide access to quality & affordable trademark registration services.

In 6 months, we have grown from 10 to 100+ registered trademarks per month, which ranks Trama among the top 10 providers in Europe. With the goal of becoming a preferred trademark registration service worldwide, we continuously strive to redefine the brand protection sector, offering our clients dedicated support and unparalleled service to protect their #1 asset.

At the same time, trademarks we register lead to follow on agenda due to oppositions, co-existence agreement negotiations, as well as trademark infringement cases. We are now dealing with dozens of cases and developing an international IP law practice.

Trama was born as a JV between Vacuumlabs a software development firm with over 250 engineers in 7 offices and Sparring a law firm with 20 lawyers focusing on IT & IP law servicing primarily technology companies and startups. We are looking for like-minded professionals to join our team

Your mission

As a fast-growing legal-tech company, our goal is to make clients feel satisfied and offer them the best possible user experience.

We are looking for someone with strong trademark know-how and management experience to ensure quality delivery and development of the legal operations team. He or she should be good at dealing with problems, have a process-oriented mindset, and good communication skills. Someone who will:

  • Become one of the leaders of our legal team to provide comprehensive legal advice, from trademark strategy design to dispute resolution.
  • Provide mentoring and guidance to the legal team and help them improve their understanding of IP law as well as case and account management
  • Proactively communicate with customers and provide clients with great customer support
  • Keep records of customer interactions, record details of inquiries, complaints, and comments, as well as actions taken.

What experience/skills will you need

  • Substantial work experience (5 years) with trademarks and IP law – so you have a deep understanding of trademark registration and dispute resolution process
  • Reliability in processes such as case and team management as well as business operations are familiar to you
  • Client-centric approach, strong communication skills, and love for the challenge of meeting new people and winning them over
  • Independence, business-oriented mindset with the ability to take control of a situation, make decisions and anticipate obstacles
  • Good task management and critical thinking
  • Fluent English in speaking and writing (C1 level) with a knowledge of legal English

What do we offer

  • Opportunity to be a part of a disruptive force in the legal field 
  • Opportunity to become a core team member in the international IP legal practice
  • Support in your professional growth, detailed feedback, and mentoring
  • Participation in international projects with exposure to the EU, UK, and US environment
  • Direct contact with clients and customers
  • Competitive benefits package including perks, such as:
    • Employee stock options
    • Free lunch & all-day catering
    • Unlimited paid sick days
    • Flexible working hours, and you can work from home
    • In-house events and company retreats are family-friendly
    • All-hands company retreats twice a year in remote locations
    • Unpaid time off and sabbatical leave are open options
    • Relax in chill-out zones with games, books and comfy couches
    • An upgrade budget to spend on your hardware any way you want to

Experience

Vacuumlabs is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and promote diversity across all of our touchpoints.

Type

Full-time job

SALARY

2,000 – 3,000 EUR

LOCATION

Bratislava, Prague, Brno, Kosice, Budapest or remote

Apply here

Or send us an email at hello@tramatm.com

ABOVE THE SALARY

Trademark Apprentice

We are looking for someone with dominant talents in execution who will make things happen and is good at dealing with problems, has a process-oriented mindset, and good communication skills.

About Trama

The brand is one of the most valuable assets of any business. Unfortunately, many entrepreneurs struggle to protect it. We’re lawyers and tech entrepreneurs who joined forces to bring 21st-century technology to the world of Law. Our aim is to reshape brand protection and provide access to quality & affordable trademark registration services.

In 6 months, we have grown from 10 to 100+ registered trademarks per month, which ranks Trama among the top 10 providers in Europe. With the goal of becoming a preferred trademark registration service worldwide, we continuously strive to redefine the brand protection sector, offering our clients dedicated support and unparalleled service to protect their #1 asset.

At the same time, trademarks we register lead to follow on agenda due to oppositions, co-existence agreement negotiations, as well as trademark infringement cases. We are now dealing with dozens of cases and developing an international IP law practice.

Trama was born as a JV between Vacuumlabs a software development firm with over 250 engineers in 7 offices and Sparring a law firm with 20 lawyers focusing on IT & IP law servicing technology companies and startups. We look for like-minded professionals to join our team.

Your mission

As a fast-growing legal-tech company, our goal is to make clients feel satisfied and offer them the best possible user experience.

We are looking for someone with dominant talents in execution who will make things happen and is good at dealing with problems, has a process-oriented mindset, and good communication skills. Someone who will:

  • Be the partner of our legal team to provide comprehensive legal advice, from thorough trademark research, through strategy design to dispute resolution.
  • Help our customers understand the trademarking process and the importance of brand protection and thus will have an essential role in sales
  • Proactively communicate with potential customers, answer their calls and emails professionally and provide clients with great customer support
  • Keep records of customer interactions, record details of inquiries, complaints, and comments, as well as actions taken
  • Be the guide for our junior colleagues in processing orders, forms, and trademark applications

What experience/skills will you need

  • Substantial work experience with trademarks or at least 3 years of experience in legal services – so the reliability in processes such as client intake, case management, and business operations is familiar to you
  • Client-centric approach, strong communication skills, and love for the challenge of meeting new people and winning them over
  • Independence, business-oriented mindset with the ability to take control of a situation, make decisions and anticipate obstacles
  • Task management and critical thinking
  • Fluent English in speaking and writing (C1 level) with a knowledge of legal English

What do we offer

  • Opportunity to be a part of a disruptive force in the legal field 
  • Learning opportunity in the area of IP law and litigation
  • Support in your professional growth, detailed feedback, and mentoring
  • Participation in international projects with exposure to the EU, UK, and US environment
  • Direct contact with clients and customers
  • Competitive benefits package including perks, such as:
    • Employee stock options
    • Unlimited paid sick days
    • Flexible working hours, and you can work from home
    • In-house events and company retreats are family-friendly
    • All-hands company retreats twice a year in remote locations
    • Unpaid time off and sabbatical leave are open options
    • Relax in chill-out zones with games, books and comfy couches
    • An upgrade budget to spend on your hardware any way you want to

Who will you work with?

We are a fast-growing international business, and you will be in the center of it all. You’ll work on diverse and engaging problems on your mission to help employees be productive and satisfied at work. You will have the power to bring and implement your ideas on how to make our company even better.

Besides working with our tech leads and with colleagues from different departments, you will be a part of an amazing team together with your 4 other team mates.

Type

Full-time job

SALARY

1,200 – 2,000 EUR

LOCATION

Bratislava, Prague, Brno, Kosice, Budapest or remote

Apply here

Or send us an email at hello@tramatm.com

Please enclose your CV in English or a link to your updated LinkedIn profile.

ABOVE THE SALARY

A few perks we call benefits

In Vacuumlabs we value and respect each other. We’re trying to create the best possible environment for all of us. It’s not only about material benefits, but also about helping each other grow and learn new things.

Explore the benefits

Selected clients

Life at Vacuumlabs

We value and respect each other while trying to create the best possible environment for all of us. It’s not only about material benefits, but also about helping you grow and learn new things. We call it the Vacuumlabs way.

About us

content.rendered:
Regional Scale-up Sales Lead (Americas)

Vacuumlabs is looking for a Sales Lead to grow our Americas business.

The Americas Scale-up Sales Lead will be responsible for the strategy, execution, and management of Vacuumlabs’ Americas growth in Scale-up business in the region.  The Sales Lead will be expected to maintain and grow relationships with some of the most exciting scale-up fintechs in North and South America.

Responsibilities will include identifying prospects, finding leads, negotiating contracts, closing sales, and managing accounts. The successful candidate will have the ability to work with clients as partners and create opportunities across the ecosystem.

Applicants should have an intimate knowledge of the financial services industry and be up-to-date with the latest in fintech, insurtech, and venture capital investments in the financial services and wider tech industry. Familiarity with the principles, tools, and technologies of modern software development would be an asset.

Job Responsibilities

  • Building a plan to meet sales targets.
  • Identifying target opportunities.
  • Prospecting for new business.
  • Negotiating and closing deals with new and existing customers.
  • Managing existing client relationships.
  • Adhering to and improving sales processes.
  • Establishing, building, and maintaining client relationships at all decision levels.
  • Representing Vacuumlabs at industry trade shows and relevant events in order to engage with prospects and other industry players. 
  • Travel to meet with clients or potential clients around the Americas region.

Qualities

  • Enjoys looking for and winning new business opportunities
  • Enjoys networking and growing relationships with scale ups, startups, VCs, and advisors
  • Competitive – driven to meet sales targets
  • A team player – works well with colleagues and customers
  • Enjoys networking in the industry – in person and virtually
  • A willingness and excitement to learn about emerging technology and the latest in the venture capital/investment space
  • Enjoys travel

Experience

  • Demonstrated success in achieving targets in sales of development services and/or consulting with a minimum of 5 years of experience.
  • Strong experience selling to Series A or later stage tech businesses. 
  • Strong contacts and references within the fintech ecosystem in the US & Canada; Latin America contacts are a bonus.
  • A curiosity about business trends and customer pain points.
  • Experienced across the entire sales life cycle and a desire to build credibility at every part of an engagement.
  • Knowledge of regional languages is a plus but certainly not a requirement

Vacuumlabs is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and promote diversity across all of our touchpoints.

Type

Full-time job

Level

Mid-Senior level

SALARY

Commensurate with experience + commissions

LOCATION

United States, Canada or remote

Apply here

Or send us an email at jobs@vacuumlabs.com

content.rendered:
Product Designer

Vacuumlabs is looking for a product designer to join our design team.

You’ll be joining a team of designers and engineers working on some of the most exciting projects in Europe and around the world. In our offices (London, Bratislava, Prague, Kosice, Brno, Budapest, NY, Hong Kong, San Francisco) you’ll hear our teams talking about complex projects from San Francisco to Tokyo.

We are looking for people who aren’t afraid of autonomy and responsibility. People who are eager to learn new things and get better at what they do. People who want to make an impact.

Our designers are problem solvers who craft highly usable experiences. Together with the team they help break down business and customer problems, imagine new and beautiful solutions, and help bring great experiences to life.

Here's what you will do

  • Contribute to ongoing design projects by making product improvements, as well as starting new products and features from scratch
  • Explore and communicate design concepts through sketches, user flows, low fidelity wireframes or prototypes
  • Participate in design research, user research and validation testing
  • Participate in product discussions and feature evaluations with the wider team and client
  • Work closely with engineers to bring designs to life
  • Continually grow and extend your design skills and knowledge

A typical career path

  • Junior designer (1200-1400 EUR): You have a growth mindset and work hard to gain experience and improve your skillset. Supported by more experienced designers, you work on rather simple tasks and help with more complex ones.
  • Mid-level designer (1600-2000 EUR): As an independent contributor, you are capable of working solo on projects that are already set up. Apart from moving pixels, you can identify what hypothesis is worth to be tested and design a test to validate it.
  • Senior designer (2250-3000 EUR): Apart from contributing to our most valuable design projects, you can take a leadership role if needed. Whether it’s travelling to meet a client, helping less experienced colleagues or making a design decision, you’ll manage.

All positions include benefits. Senior positions include also equity options. 

Our application process

  • 1. Design Exercise
    The task will be to design a product on paper in 30 minutes. You can ask us questions during the process. When the countdown ends, you will present your solution.
  • 2. Design critique
    You will be searching for usability issues in the app prototype. After having 10 minutes to get familiar with the prototype, you will present us with as many usability issues as you can.
  • 3. Take-home assignment
    Your homework will be to design UI(s) specified at the end of our meeting. We’ll email to you any wireframes or assets needed for completion.
  • Choose your location: Bratislava, Košice, Prague, Brno, Budapest, Remote

Who do we look for

  • You have experience in designing mobile and web applications and a portfolio to show
  • You have detail oriented approach to design and take pride in high quality work
  • You have knowledge of design patterns and current best practices in UX and UI design
  • You are able to maintain and evolve the brand’s tone of voice and visual language
  • You have a practical knowledge of design systems and style guides
  • You are open to feedback and interested in an iterative design process
  • You have strong verbal and written English skills and are able to communicate your thoughts and ideas effectively to the team as well as international stakeholders
  • Bonus skills such as UX writing, motion design, 3D design etc. are very welcome

Type

Full-time job

MONTHLY SALARY

1,600 – 3,000 EUR

LOCATION

Bratislava, Prague, Brno, Kosice, Budapest or remote.

Apply here

Or send us an email at jobs@vacuumlabs.com
